title: Find the Number of Orbits
text: The age of Earth is approximately $$4\times{10}^9$$ years. Since Earth completes one orbit around the Sun in one year, the total number of orbits is exactly $$4\times{10}^9$$.

title: Calculate the Circumference of Earth's Orbit
text: The formula for the circumference of a circle is $$C=2π r$$ where we have the radius $$r=1.5\times{10}^{11} m$$. What is the circumference of the Earth?

title: Total Distance Formula
text: The total distance Earth has traveled is the number of orbits multiplied by the circumference of its orbit: Total $$Distance=Number$$ of orbits×Circumference
